result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Preliminary hearing held on July 20, 2022 prepared by Court Reporter Samantha Brushaber

10:00 AM Defendant James E Sims in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for James E Sims.  Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Klein is not counsel of record. 
All parties request a further status hearing in this matter. 
Discovery has been received.

10:15 AM Defendant James E Sims in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for James E Sims.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for James E Sims.  Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
The public defenders office must withdraw themselves from this matter. 
Atty Opper would like to set matter for a quick turn around if this matter to be appointed new counsel. 
Atty Opper reports discovery has been turned over to counsel. 
Court sets status of counsel. 
Court grants motion to withdraw in this matter and states reasons on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

filed by Atty Hughes
**Matter to be stacked onto the 9/1/22 hearing date per court**
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:18 AM Defendant James E Sims in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia and attorney Steven Hughes.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State is in compliance with victims rights and victims present in court today.
Defense prepared to proceed to a preliminary hearing.
City of Oconomowoc Detective Kurt Franke sworn in and testified on direct by DA Opper.
Cross examination by Attorney Hughes.
State rests.
DA Opper moves for bind over without further argument.
Attorney Hughes presents closing arguments and requests the Court deny the request for bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.
